tool_description: Public access to all 6,100+ videos' data in the ESOVDB, in JSON format.
name: The Earth Science Online Video Database
title: The Earth Science Online Video Database
tool_name: The Earth Science Online Video Database

api_list.name: Get video by YouTube ID
api_list.description: Many videos in the ESOVDB are hosted on YouTube.  This endpoint accepts a YouTube ID (a code in the URL, for example: youtu.be/{videoId} or youtube.com/watch?v={videoId}), either as a path parameter or a query parameter (one of these is required), and it returns that video's ESOVDB record, by default as `format=raw|json` (the raw Airtable-created JSON, which includes all fields).  As with the other endpoints, other formats are available, which at this time include the `format=youtube|yt` format, which is a simplified format that consists only of `id` (the video's YouTube video ID), `recordId` (the video's ESOVDB Airtable record ID), `esovdbId` (the video's ESOVDB ID), `zoteroKey` (the video's key in the ESOVDB Zotero library), and `added` (the timestamp of when the video was added to the ESOVDB in ISO-8601 format)  and `format=zotero` (the Zotero-oriented format used for turning ESOVDB videos into Zotero `videoRecording` items).

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description:
Optionally specify a specific format for each video record.  Currently all formats are JSON objects, with different sets properties.

**`raw`** *(alias `json`)* - formats each video as raw JSON data sent from the ESOVDB Airtable, containing all available fields.  Largest in size.

**`zotero`** - formats each video as a set of fields compatible with and named according to the `videoRecording` type item in Zotero, for use in syncing ESOVDB videos with Zotero

**`youtube`** *(alias `yt`) *- formats each video as a limited set of fields pertaining to a video's online presence.  Meant for use with YouTube-based videos, used by the ESOVDB chrome extension, the ESOVDB iOS shortcut, and various ESOVDB Discord bots to determine if a YouTube video is already in the ESOVDB.  Response fields include: `videoId`, its YouTube video ID, `recordId`, its Airtable record ID, `esovdbId`, its ESOVDB ID, `zoteroKey`, its Zotero Key, and `added`, a timestamp of when the video was added to the ESOVDB in ISO-8601 format.

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description:
### Path Parameter

*e.g. /v1/videos/youtube/{id}*

A YouTube video's videoId (the code in the video's URL found in either the format *youtu.be/{videoId}* or *youtube.com/watch?v={videoId}*.

If this path parameter is omitted, `id` must be passed as a URL query parameter.  If both an `id` path parameter and an `id` query parameter are provided, the path parameter will be used instead of the query parameter. A request made to this endpoint without either will return an error.

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description:
### Query Parameter

*e.g. /v1/videos/youtube/{id}*

A YouTube video's videoId (the code in the video's URL found in either the format *youtu.be/{videoId}* or *youtube.com/watch?v={videoId}*.

This URL query parameter is optional, but if omitted, `id` must be passed as a path parameter.  If both an `id` path parameter and an `id` query parameter are provided, the path parameter will be used instead of the query parameter. A request made to this endpoint without either will return an error.

api_list.name: Get all videos
api_list.description:
Gets all 6,100+ videos from the Earth Science Online Database, as a large JSON file.  Even though the API server caches all the videos every 24 hours, and API users are only ever querying what videos have been added or updated since then, the resulting JSON file is large, and this request may take a moment to complete.

Premium users of this endpoint will always receive completely fresh data, never cached.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description:
Optionally specify a specific format for each video record.  Currently all formats are JSON objects, with different sets properties.

**`raw`** *(alias `json`)* - formats each video as raw JSON data sent from the ESOVDB Airtable, containing all available fields.  Largest in size.

**`zotero`** - formats each video as a set of fields compatible with and named according to the `videoRecording` type item in Zotero, for use in syncing ESOVDB videos with Zotero

**`youtube`** *(alias `yt`) *- formats each video as a limited set of fields pertaining to a video's online presence.  Meant for use with YouTube-based videos, used by the ESOVDB chrome extension, the ESOVDB iOS shortcut, and various ESOVDB Discord bots to determine if a YouTube video is already in the ESOVDB.  Response fields include: `videoId`, its YouTube video ID, `recordId`, its Airtable record ID, `esovdbId`, its ESOVDB ID, `zoteroKey`, its Zotero Key, and `added`, a timestamp of when the video was added to the ESOVDB in ISO-8601 format.

api_list.name: Get all webhooks
api_list.description: Without any parameters specified, returns a list of all canonical webhook events.  If the client includes a valid `url` callback parameter in the request, this endpoint instead returns a list of only the webhook events to which the provided callback URL is subscribed.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: Specifying the `url` query parameter will change the nature of the request to return the set of webhook events within the set of all canonical webhook events, to which the provided callback URL is subscribed.

api_list.name: Query videos
api_list.description: Return a subset of the ESOVDB's 6,100+ videos using various parameters to search and filter the ESOVDB's videos.

optional_parameters.name: createdAfter
optional_parameters.description: (URL-encoded string representing a date in the past which can be parsed by Javascript's `Date.parse()` function)  The value of `modifiedAfter` and `createdAfter` is a date in string format,  URL-encoded, which is parseable by Javascript's `Date.parse()` function.  This means for example, you can specify dates as strings such as '2021-12-21 10:00 am', '2021-12-21 10:00 am EST', '2021-12-12', '12/21/2021', '2021-12', 'December 21, 2021', 'December 12, 2021 10:00 am GMT-05', etc, provided the string is then URL-encoded. (e.g. 'December 12, 2021 10:00 am GMT-05' => 'December%2012%2C%202021%2010%3A00%20am%20GMT-05').  Any format that is understood by Javascript's `Date.parse()` function and then URL-encoded will work.

optional_parameters.name: modifiedAfter
optional_parameters.description: (URL-encoded string representing a date in the past which can be parsed by Javascript's `Date.parse()` function)  The value of `modifiedAfter` and `createdAfter` is a date in string format,  URL-encoded, which is parseable by Javascript's `Date.parse()` function.  This means for example, you can specify dates as strings such as '2021-12-21 10:00 am', '2021-12-21 10:00 am EST', '2021-12-12', '12/21/2021', '2021-12', 'December 21, 2021', 'December 12, 2021 10:00 am GMT-05', etc, provided the string is then URL-encoded. (e.g. 'December 12, 2021 10:00 am GMT-05' => 'December%2012%2C%202021%2010%3A00%20am%20GMT-05').  Any format that is understood by Javascript's `Date.parse()` function and then URL-encoded will work.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description:
Optionally specify a specific format for each video record.  Currently all formats are JSON objects, with different sets properties.

**`raw`** *(alias `json`)* - formats each video as raw JSON data sent from the ESOVDB Airtable, containing all available fields.  Largest in size.

**`zotero`** - formats each video as a set of fields compatible with and named according to the `videoRecording` type item in Zotero, for use in syncing ESOVDB videos with Zotero

**`youtube`** *(alias `yt`) *- formats each video as a limited set of fields pertaining to a video's online presence.  Meant for use with YouTube-based videos, used by the ESOVDB chrome extension, the ESOVDB iOS shortcut, and various ESOVDB Discord bots to determine if a YouTube video is already in the ESOVDB.  Response fields include: `videoId`, its YouTube video ID, `recordId`, its Airtable record ID, `esovdbId`, its ESOVDB ID, `zoteroKey`, its Zotero Key, and `added`, a timestamp of when the video was added to the ESOVDB in ISO-8601 format.

optional_parameters.name: maxRecords
optional_parameters.description: (Integer greater than 1, default=null) Setting `maxRecords` ensures that your `videos/query` response will never return more than `maxRecords` number of items.  As with all requests to the `videos` set of endpoints, the records included in the response are sorted by most recently modified, unless another sort is specified (coming soon).

optional_parameters.name: pg
optional_parameters.description: Return a specific paged result of the query (default `pageSize` is 100, or you can also specify `pageSize` from 1 to 100).

optional_parameters.name: pageSize
optional_parameters.description: (Integer from 1-100, default=100) The ESOVDB is based on Airtable, which paginates the results of querying its data.  So the `pageSize` query parameter will determine the number of each of those records in those pages.  This means a small `pageSize` could make value could make for either a very slow request (if the total returned records is a large number), or a faster request (if the total returned records are smaller than or equal to `pageSize`.  Additionally, `pageSize` can be useful used in concert with the `:pg` URL path parameter—for example, the request path `/videos/query/2?pageSize=50` will return records 51-100, from all of the videos in the ESOVDB, ordered by most recently modified.
